Package Graphics

Class Circle

java.lang.Object
Graphics.GraphicsObject
Graphics.Circle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class Circle extends GraphicsObject
Circle is a drawable circle object.

  • Constructor Details

    • Circle

      public Circle(Point center, double radius)
      Initializes a new Circle object given a center and a radius.

      The Point object is not stored directly; it is copied instead. The original object may be changed without affecting the Circle.

      Parameters:
      center - The center of the circle
      radius - The radius of the circle

    • Circle

      public Circle(Circle other)
      Creates a copy of the given Circle.

      The new Circle object does not get the drawn status of the original circle.

      Parameters:
      other - The Circle object to copy

  • Method Details

      public void setOutline(ColorRGB color)
      Description copied from class: GraphicsObject
      Set the outline color for this object.

      Every derived class should probably override this.

      Overrides:

      Parameters:

    • setFill

      public void setFill(ColorRGB color)
      Description copied from class: GraphicsObject
      Set the fill color for this object.

      Derived classes override this if and only if they support filled objects.

      Overrides:
      setFill in class GraphicsObject
      Parameters:
      color - A ColorRGB object specifying the fill color.

    • doDraw

      protected void doDraw(Graphics g)
      Description copied from class: GraphicsObject
      Draw the object.

      This must be overridden by every derived class. It is called when the object is first drawn, and every time the display list is redrawn.

      Specified by:
      doDraw in class GraphicsObject
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics object to draw into.

    • doMove

      protected void doMove(double dx, double dy)
      Description copied from class: GraphicsObject
      Move the object.

      Note that the move is specified as a delta, not an absolute position.

      This must be overridden by every derived class. It is called when move() is called for the object. The derived class should only modify the object position; the actual drawing is done by the base class.

      Specified by:
      doMove in class GraphicsObject
      Parameters:
      dx - The x distance to move.
      dy - The y distance to move.
